sentences.english: Then did Big bro meet any girl out there?
sentences.chinese: 那大师兄有否在江湖上遇到什么红颜知己？

sentences.english: How many man anger are the young people, how many ingredient flew the swallow with Lin Niao.
sentences.chinese: 多少男子汉一怒为红颜，多少同林鸟已成分飞燕。

sentences.english: She was Dan's favorite model, cherished confidante and dearest friend.
sentences.chinese: 她是丹最爱的偶像，珍视的红颜知己和挚友。

sentences.english: That dress is a beautiful hue of red.
sentences.chinese: 那条裙子的红颜色真好看。

sentences.english: Decades pass by, they donot look young with hair turning from black to white.
sentences.chinese: 数十年后，青丝换了白发，红颜不再。

sentences.english: Does she can tell her family she is your female confidant?
sentences.chinese: 她可以大胆地告诉她的家人，她是你的红颜知已吗？

sentences.english: She is a very considerate person, always patient and in fact is the merchant's connfidante.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，她是商人的红颜知己。

sentences.english: Graceful jading years often goes beauty no longer, state of mind also becomes eccentric.
sentences.chinese: 曼璐年华老去红颜不再，心态也变得古怪。

sentences.english: If Tong Pak Fu had a friend like you, he wouldn't have any regrets.
sentences.chinese: 如果唐伯虎能够有你这位红颜知己，真是死而无憾呀。

sentences.english: She is a very considerate person, always patient and in fact is the merchant’s confidante.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，她是商人的红颜知己。

sentences.english: Is the most sentimental time, his coffin.
sentences.chinese: 最最伤感是流年，白发罩住了红颜。

sentences.english: Have you visited the house whose color (the color of which) is red?
sentences.chinese: 你参观过那栋红颜色的房子吗？

sentences.english: See, when spring draws to a close and flowers fall, This is the season when beauty must ebb and fade;
sentences.chinese: 试看春残花渐落，便是红颜老死时。

sentences.english: Mortal woman, who can have such as fox, old confidante?
sentences.chinese: 俗世女子，谁能够如狐般拥有不老红颜？

sentences.english: The red of this rose is wonderful.
sentences.chinese: 这朵玫瑰花的红颜色真美丽极了。

sentences.english: Once the spring as confidante old, people now know flowers two.
sentences.chinese: 一朝春尽红颜老，花落人亡现两不知。

definition: rouge and powder/(fig.) the fair sex
romance/beautiful scenery/small or petty (of talk etc)
to be born under an unlucky star (usu. of women)/to be born unlucky
beauty unmatched in her generation (idiom); woman of peerless elegance/prettiest girl ever
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
distinguished and accomplished/outstanding/talented in letters and unconventional in lifestyle/romantic/dissolute/loose
